Field.Description: This is a special format used in KBP When used in the KBP Forward DBs (e.g. KBP_IPV4_UNICAST_PRIVATE_LPM_FORWARD) Forward results in 24b/32b buffer in the KBP are zero padded (on the MSBs) to 64b on the KBP>DNX bus The zero padding is taken as the "Type", i.e. for 24b/32b the Type is not encoded on the entry itself in the KBP Buffer KBP_DEST_W_DEFAULT can be used in KBP forwarding DBs (e.g. KBP_IPV4_UNICAST_PRIVATE_LPM_FORWARD) in 3 possible sub formats: 1. As a 24b result with up to 2b KBP_FORWARD_PMF_GENERIC_DATA used by PMF 2. As a 32b result with up to 10b KBP_FORWARD_PMF_GENERIC_DATA used by PMF 3. As a 64b result with up to 36b KBP_FORWARD_PMF_GENERIC_DATA used by PMF (in the 64b format 6b on the buffer are used as type) When used in the KBP RPF DBs (e.g. KBP_IPV4_UNICAST_PRIVATE_LPM_RPF) RPF results in 24b buffer in the KBP are zero padded (on the MSBs) to 32b on the KBP>DNX bus The zero padding is taken as the "Type", i.e. for 24b the Type is not encoded on the entry itself in the KBP Buffer KBP_DEST_W_DEFAULT can be used in KBP RPF DBs (e.g. KBP_IPV4_UNICAST_PRIVATE_LPM_RPF) in 2 possible sub formats: 1. As a 24b result with up to 2b KBP_FORWARD_PMF_GENERIC_DATA used by PMF 2. As a 32b result with up to 4b KBP_FORWARD_PMF_GENERIC_DATA used by PMF (in the 32b format 6b on the buffer are used as type) Note: Future implementation can increase the number of bits available for KBP_FORWARD_PMF_GENERIC_DATA in RPF 32b result by using type smaller than 6b
Field.Name: RESULT_TYPE
